metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14291 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Xpdf 4.01.01. There is an out of bounds read in the function GfxPatchMeshShading::parse at GfxState.cc for typeA==6 case 3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14291` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 ebarretto> since 0.5.12-1 libextractor does not use xpdf anymore. xpdf in Debian uses poppler, which is not affected or fixed

criterions.comment: ipe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
poppler package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14').
xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
